summary: The bill, titled the Protecting First Responders from Secondary Exposure Act of 2025, amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968. It aims to authorize the use of grant money to provide training and resources for first responders on the use of containment devices to prevent secondary exposure to fentanyl and other potentially lethal substances. The bill also allows for the purchase of these containment devices for first responders.
